comment.author: 52014195@N08
comment._content: Awesome shot! I need to look up that fort, I wonder what uses it was put to. Here in the U.S. ,most of our coastal forts never saw a lot of use, some being made into prisons or put to other uses. One today is part of a national park and a major bird sanctuary.

comment.author: 57155298@N02
comment._content: I'll take a guess and say Fort Denison

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/52014195@N08] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/help33] Hi folks, the Dictionary of Sydney website has a great entry on Fort Denison - which is still a feature of Sydney Harbour to this day! www.dictionaryofsydney.org/entry/fort_denison
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons
